addressleaf.section:
To my L. T
re
r Au
g
11 1592 by G Lover

page.lettertext:
fol.273r
1592 xj August To my L. Trea
s
by G Lover
May it please your good L. I know not who had undertaken
e c
o
veyance of your l
re
of
e 29 of
e last. It was s
e
t me out
of
Zeland
, and brought me but to day, by a post of this c
o
trie,
who knewe not
e partie
at delivered it unto him. Which
I thought somewhat re
q
sit to signifie to your L. because I
had some l
re
s of
e very same date, w
ch
were written me from
London
, and delivered to my hands above six dayes before.
Moreover your L. maketh m
e
tion of a l
re
from
her
M
tie
to
e
States
of this c
o
trey, w
ch
was dispatched from
e
Court
about 3 dayes before, w
ch
is not yet come hither.
I have sent at this p
nt
a messenger of purpose, to adver-
tise
S
r
Francis Vere
, w
at
your L. hath written for giving warning
to
e Captaines to keepe theyr c
o
panies in a readines: wherin
I assure my self for them,
at they will shewe no kinde of
backwardnes. And though I make full account,
at
e States
will shewe no willingnes, yet to speake w
at
I c
o
jecture,
I thinke by way of sufferance, they will licence them to
passe. For besides
at they expect their forces out of Fr
a
ce,
w
t
e very first winde, w
ch
will quickly be renforced to
double
e number, there are already come to
Sheremberg
in
e countie of
Zu
t
phen
, of
e ensiegnes they have raised
in
e countrey of
Juliers,
a 1000 men: and there are as
many coming after, of
e selfe same levie:
at I see no colour
for
e states to
p
tend themselves to be disfournished.
Having sent one unto you abowt two dayes past
and no occurrence c
o
ming sins,
at may deserve a long
[er]
letter, I take my humble leave. At
e Hage. Au
g
11
[1592]
